alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 5:28AM PST until February 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches valleys and 5 to 10 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Metaline, Fruitland, Colville, Kettle Falls, Eastport, Priest River, Chewelah, Athol, Sandpoint, Flowery Trail Road, Bonners Ferry, Orin-Rice Road, Northport, Deer Park, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Metaline Falls, Ione, Tiger, Springdale-Hunters Road, Clark Fork, and Newport. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Untreated roads will likely become very slick by early Tuesday evening as temperatures quickly drop. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tuesday morning accumulations are possible mainly around Metaline Falls and the North Idaho Panhandle. The majority of the accumulations are expected Tuesday afternoon into the evening. Flash freeze conditions may occur with dropping temperatures and snowfall on cold roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
